text: Hi, I'm Eddie. I am a formal learn
communicator here in at Bristol. In our
water cycle workshop, we talk about
super cool water. I've got a demo here
for you that is great to try at home.
So, you may notice on those cold winter
evenings, people place salt out on the
streets and pavements. Because salty
water can go well below 0° C and remain
liquid before it freezes. We're going to
try and get a bottle of fresh water to
get well below 0 degrees but still
remain a liquid. For your super cold
water
demo, you need lots and lots of crushed
ice. Small bottle of
water, a beaker with round about 100 mls
of tap
water, plenty of table
salt,
teaspoon, and a metal cylinder to place
all of your ingredients inside. First
thing I'm going to do is to pour plenty
of crushed ice into the bottom of my
metal cylinder. Then I need five
teaspoons of salt to sprinkle
around. I'm going to now place my small
water bottle inside around that water
bottle. Now I need to pack in as much
ice as
possible. Now another five spoon of
salt.
Next, I'm going to take 100 mls of water
and add 5 teaspoon of salt to
[Music]
this. Stir the mixture around. Now, I'm
going to pour this salty water all
around the ice around my bottle. Now, if
you've got any room, just add some more
ice on top. All we do now is just sit
and wait for a good 30 minutes and then
our super cold water should be ready.
The reason why I can get a bottle of
fresh water below 0° without freezing is
because in our bottle water, we have no
nucleation points. Now, nucleation
points is simply any impurities inside
that bottle of water which is going to
allow ice crystals to form around it.
Now, when I have my bottle of fresh
water, that is a liquid, but below 0
degrees, if I cause a disturbance, like
pouring that water over ice cube, I'm
going to create many nucleation sites,
and that liquid will turn to ice
instantly. It's been about 30 minutes
now, so let's see if our super cold
water is ready to make some instant ice.
[Music]
So there you go. Instant ice. Fantastic
experiment. Why don't you try at home?
[Music]
